topic.para: Administrators and developers can and may need to adapt various aspects of the SELinux policy to accommodate specialized workloads and deployment scenarios. This due to the design principles of the targeted policy, as seen in .

This includes adjusting network port contexts, managing policy modules, defining and modifying file contexts, controlling policy behavior via booleans, setting domains to permissive mode for troubleshooting, and enabling or disabling dontaudit rules to enhance policy development or auditing.
